g.text: • Basic building block for other flip-flops
• No invalid states like SR flip-flop
• Q follows D on clock edge
• Connect J and K inputs together
• Used in counters and frequency dividers
• Toggles output on each clock pulse when T=1
• Prevents input changes during clock transition
• More reliable than simple edge-triggered FF
• Output changes only on negative clock edge
• FF responds to input changes during entire clock level
• Can change multiple times during clock HIGH/LOW
• FF responds only at clock edge (rising or falling)
• Single state change per clock cycle
• Most commonly used in digital systems
• Less common, used in specific applications
